discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The API secret can't be retrieved after creating a API client secret.

choices.B: Within the API management page, API client secrets can be accessed within the "edit client" functionality
choices.C: The API client secret must be reset or a new client created as the secret cannot be viewed after it has been created
choices.A: Selecting "show secret" within the 3-dot dropdown menu will reveal the secret for the selected api client
choices.D: The API client secret can be provided by support via direct email request from a Falcon Administrator

questions.question_text: How can a API client secret be viewed after it has been created?
Which of the following is NOT an available action for an API Client?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct, based on Check UI Dashboard

questions.question_text: The Falcon Administrator has created a new prevention policy to apply to the "Servers" group; however, when applying the new prevention policy this group is not appearing in the list of available groups. What is the most likely issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Checked and verified on the Falcon console.

choices.C: The new prevention policy should be enabled first
choices.A: The "Servers" group already has a policy applied to it
choices.D: Host type was not defined correctly within the prevention policy
choices.B: The "Servers" group must be disabled first

questions.question_text: What critical prevention policy setting prevents sensor-related files, folders, and registry objects from being renamed or deleted?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
As checked on Prevention Policy on Falcon Console page.

questions.question_text: When editing an existing IOA exclusion, what can NOT be edited?

choices.B: All parts of the exclusion can be changed

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The exclusion name can be modified, but not the IOA name.

Selected Answer: B
Tested in UI, answer B

Selected Answer: C
All parts from the exclusion itself can be edited, but the console itself attaches an "IOA name" which can not be edited, but this is not exactly a part of the exclusion as it appears in all detections so tbh idk, confusing question. My logic tells me the correct answer is B (all parts can be changed) but crowd wants you to answer c (IOA name cant be changed), but both are correct to me.

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer. All parts are editable.

Selected Answer: C
Exclusion name can be changed but IOA name can´t since it is automatically created from a detection.

Selected Answer: A
Tested on the Console you can edit everything

Selected Answer: B
Test in console, you can change all

Selected Answer: C
Literally testing in the UI now. You can’t change it.

Selected Answer: B
Absolutely all can be changed. Answer is B

Selected Answer: C
Tested in UI
